intro: Holodictyum, commonly known as sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Plumbaginaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, often spiny leaves and showy, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. These plants are typically found in coastal areas, rocky shores, and saline soils, showcasing their adaptability to harsh environments. Holodictyum species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. They play a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and supporting local wildlife.
